item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 126 - Soul Special
item.description: It’s often said that if many of the great reggae vocalists who recorded in the 60’s and 70’s had been born in America, then they would have been as big as the likes of Curtis Mayfield, Otis Redding and Marvin Gaye and so I’m going to try and prove that theory today, as I’ve dug deep and pulled out some of my favourite soulful Jamaican records in the House of Reggae’s Soul Special… Jackie Mittoo – Henry The Great Jimmy Cliff – Many Rivers To Cross Jackie Opel – Cry Me A River Jackie Opel – Came Back Where You Belong The Maytals – Daddy Johnny Osbourne – We Need Love Ken Parker – Count Your Blessings - version Slim Smith – Pity In The City Glen Miller – Where Is The Love Beres Hammond – One Step Ahead Marcia Griffiths – Send Me Some Loving Bob Andy – I Would Be A Fool Jackie Edwards – Your Eyes Are Dreaming Jackie Opel – Shelter In The Storm Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian
item.dc:creator: House of Reggae
item.itunes:summary:
It’s often said that if many of the great reggae vocalists who recorded in the 60’s and 70’s had been born in America, then they would have been as big as the likes of Curtis Mayfield, Otis Redding and Marvin Gaye and so I’m going to try and prove that theory today, as I’ve dug deep and pulled out some of my favourite soulful Jamaican records in the House of Reggae’s Soul Special…

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 125
item.description: If you listen to this podcast on the bus on the way to work or on the train on the way to zion, just pop in your headphones and let the music take you away… Konshens – Pop In My Headphones Busy Signal – Kingston Town Lloyd Charmers – Save The People Scotty – Salvation Train Ken Boothe – Is It Because I’m Black Vivian Jones – Black Thing Ken Boothe – Black, Gold & Green Jah Mali – Blood Thirsty Derrick Harriott – Solomon Junior Murvin – Solomon Nitty Gritty – She’s A Delilah Josey Wales – Solomon Style Charlie Organaire – Royal Charley Charlie Organaire – Little Village Chronixx – Warrior Garnett Silk – Lion Heart Buju Banton – Massa God World A Run Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 124 - Marriage Special
item.description: We are gathered here today to join together in matrimony fine Jamaican music with another House of Reggae theme, by exploring the good, the bad and the bizarre of weddings and marriages in the House of Reggae’s Marriage Special… Jackie Mittoo – Rocksteady Wedding Marcia Griffiths – Melody Life The Shades – I Know A Girl Derrick & Patsy – Are You Going To Marry Me Glen Brown – 2 Wedden Skank Yellowman – I’m Getting Married Dennis Alcapone – The Wedding Song Ijahman & Madge – I Do Lt Stitchie – Obeah Wedding Paulette – Stop The Wedding Tanya Stephens – Damn You The Meditations – Marriage Dugsy Ranks – Wifey Papa San & Lady G – Legal Rights Barrington Levy – Quick Divorce Gregory Isaacs – Happy Anniversary Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

We are gathered here today to join together in matrimony fine Jamaican music with another House of Reggae theme, by exploring the good, the bad and the bizarre of weddings and marriages in the House of Reggae’s Marriage Special…

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 123
item.description: Step aboard for another hour long celebration of fine Jamaican music that will span the decades and genres and highlight the talent and artistry that continues to shine brightly from the island in the sun… Derrick Morgan – It’s Alright Devon & The Tartans – Making Love Early B – Me Want Join The Army The Traps – Higher Mike Brooks – Money Is Not All Mike Brooks – Prime Minister Jamaican Coasters – Stoney Hill Wailing Souls – Back Out With It Wailing Souls – Things & Time Nitty Gritty – Gimme Some A Your Something Chaka Demus – World Wide Trouble Admiral Tibet – Leave People Business Bumps Oakley – A Get A Lick Carlton Livingston – Itch It Up Operator Peetah Morgan – Selfish Ways Delly Ranks – Push On Derrick Morgan – I Need Someone Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae and Big Mikey Dread Say Come Spar Wid Us
item.description: In deepest mid-winter with snow all around, two reggae enthusiasts met in a shed in the middle of the country to play records and chat away to their hearts content, and with the power of modern technology, you’re invited in too, as House of Reggae and Big Mikey Dread say come spar wid us… Jimmy Smith – The Preacher Delroy Wilson – Have Some Mercy Jah Ali – Soldier Round The Corner The Ethiopians – Band Your Belly Junior Byles – Know Where Your Going Richie Spice – Earth A Run Red (remix) Suprcat – Cry Fi Di Youth Little John & Billy Boyo – What You Want To Be Pat Kelly – Dark End Of The Street Don Tony Lee – Peyton Place Lord Lebby – Danny Boy Jackie Opel – I Am What I Am The Gaylads – ABC Rocksteady Macka B – Never Played A 45 Well Pleased & Satisfied – Sweetie Come From America Tomorrow’s Children – Bang Bang Rocksteady Johnny Osbourne – See & Blind Johnny Osbourne – Stop The Fighting Earl Cunningham & Jah Thomas - Words of the Father 12” The Prophets & Trinity – King Pharoah’s Plague 12” Jah Stitch – Aggrovators Knock Them Out Johnny Clarke & Ranking Trevor – Warrior & Whip Them Jah 12” Junior Ross & The Spears – Babylon Fall Lee Perry – White Belly Rat Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 122
item.description: Step this way for another 60 minutes of tributes, dedications, versions, new releases, old favourites and a little bit of detail and trivia… King Stitt – Fire Corner Hopeton Lewis – Live It Up Mr Williamz – Last Night Jiving Juniors – Over The River Eddie Tan Tan Thornton – Tantanlizing Dillinger – Natty Dread Ah Carry The Swing Roland Alphonso feat. King Stitt – Four Corners King Stitt – I For I Ernie Freeman – Live It Up The Skatalites – Beardman Ska King Stitt & Andy Capp – Herbsman Shuffle Beenie Man – Foundation Dirtsman – Hot This Year The Beltones – Dancing Time King Stitt – Rhyming Time Sammy Dread & Peter Ranking – African Girl Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 121 - Acoustic Special
item.description: Reggae music prides itself on big bass lines pumping out of vibrating speaker boxes and so today we’re doing something a little way different as I’m going to turn down the bass speakers and go unplugged in the House of Reggae’s acoustic special… Bob Marley – Redemption Song The Sharks – You Made Me Warm Joe Higgs – There’s A Reward Dennis Brown – Have You Ever Earl Chinna Smith – We Got Love The Viceroys – Heart Made Of Stone Clinton Fearon – One More River Richie Spice – Earth A Run Red (remix) Bascom X – Danger Jah Mason – The People Fanton Mojah – What Is This Lukie D – Make A Change Tanya Stephens – What A Day Junior Kelly – Standing Firm Brushy One String – Another Song Of Praise Burning Spear – Jah No Dead Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 120 - Techniques Special
item.description: Singer, producer and record label owner Winston Riley died on the 19th January, and so today I’m paying my small tribute to the man who during his 50 year career released some of the biggest records and rhythms in reggae music, in the House of Reggae’s Techniques Special… Ansel Collins – Stalag 17 The Techniques – My Girl Johnny Osbourne – Warrior Dave & Ansel Collins – Double Barrel Johnny Osbourne – Purify Your Heart Jimmy Riley – Prophecy The Interns – Nothing Is Impossible Winston & Ansel – Zion I Madoo – Coming From Town General Echo – Bathroom Sex Sister Nancy – Bam Bam Tenor Saw – Ring The Alarm Super Beagle – Dust A Sound Boy Reggiis Stepper – Cu-oonuh Super Cat – Boops Junie Ranks – Cry Fi Mi Boops Red Dragon – Hol A Fresh Sanchez – Sad Song Admiral Tibet – Who Feels It Knows It Frankie Paul & Buju Banton – Bring Yu Body Come To Me Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 119
item.description: Welcome in once again for another 60 minutes of fine Jamaican music, interspersed with a little bit of detail and trivia, which hopefully will keep you entertained, enthralled and maybe even enlightened… Leroy Smart – God Helps The Man Spiritual Movements – Serious Time The Maytals – Hold On Ras Demo – Make You Rock Carl Dawkins – Dr Rodney Lui Lepke – Walter Rodney Flourgon – We Run Things Zoot Simms – Press Along Prince Larry & Alvin – Press Along Nyah Al Campbell – Press Along Youthman Trinity – Press Along Sister The Upsetters – High Plains Drifter Joshua Moses – Africa Is Our Land Don Carlos – Nice Time (Late Night Blues) Roy Rankin – Go Deh In A Late Night Blues Raymond Naptali – Late Night Session Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 118 - Xterminator Special
item.description: The Xterminator label released some of the greatest roots music out of Jamaica throughout the 1990’s, and helped launch the careers of the likes of Capleton, Luciano and Sizzla, however the label’s owner and producer, Mr Philip ‘Fatis’ Burrell, very sadly passed away on the 3rd December 2011, so in tribute to his great contribution to Jamaican music, here is the House of Reggae’s Xterminator Special… Dean Fraser – Barefoot African Capleton – Alms House Beres Hammond – Emptiness Inside Luciano & Selvyn Wonder – Neighbourhood Watch Luciano – It’s Me Again Jah Mikey General – Sinners Sanchez – Praise HIM Cocoa Tea – Israel’s King Ini Kamoze – Hill & Gully Ride Jah Cure – Trod In The Valley Sizzla – Praise Ye Jah Luciano – Sweep Over My Soul Chezidek – Harvest Time Tanya Stephens – What A Day Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae 2011 Annual
item.description: Another 12 months has passed by in the blink of an eye, so it must be time to look back, take stock and gather up some of the top tunes that have been shaking my musical tree, for the House of Reggae’s 2011 Annual… Mr Vegas feat. Shaggy & Josey Wales – Sweet Jamaica Tarrus Riley – Shaka Zulu Pickney Vybz Kartel – Poor People Land Protoje – Take Control Lukie D & Busy Signal – Man A Yardie Richie Stephens – No Sah Courtney John – Never Keep You Waiting Jah 9 – Warning Iba Mahr – Will I Wait Queen Ifrica – Pot Still Haffi Bubble The Uprising Roots Band – Steamers Raging Fyah – Judgement Day Kali Blaxx – Farmer Man Jesse Royal – Bittersweet Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 117
item.description: Welcome in for another tea and biscuit festooned celebration of fine Jamaican music… The Melodians – Song Of Love Roy Panton – Endless Memory Roman Stewart – Fire At Your Heel The Sunshot Band – Dr Bash Neville Grant – Sick And Tired The Upsetters – Return Of Django The Heptones – Book Of Rules The Heptones – Can’t Hide From Jah Dennis Alcapone – Joe Frazier Burning Spear – He Prayed The Upsetters – Cloak & Dagger Dillinger – Dub Organizer Lizard – Show Dem The Way Candy McKenzie – Someone To Love Me Super & Sleepy – Enemy Jimmy Cliff – Dearest Beverley Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. item.title: House of Reggae meets Big Mikey Dread ina Mellow Tone
item.description: Big Mikey Dread Reggae Radio http://bigmikeydread.podomatic.com/ visited the House of Reggae again last week, so I couldn’t let him go without recording another in our occasional series of great choons and silly chat… Lloyd & Devon – Love Is The Foundation Of The World Organ instrumental version Johnny Clarke – Don’t Go The Heptones – Meaning Of Life Pat Kelly – I Don’t Want To Go The Gaylads(?) – Lonely Man Bob Marley – Redder Than Red Lloyd Parks – Ordinary Man Max Romeo – Fire Fe The Vatican Jah Lion – Leggo Eric Clarke – Fight Against Babylon Leroy Smart – Oh Marcus I Roy – Tribute To Marcus Garvey Unknown - Rocks And Mountains Barry Brown - Give Thanks and Praise Maxie - Some African Well Pleased and Satisfied - Black On Black Junior Byles - What Kind Of World Ranking Buckers – East Stepping Wailing Souls - Things and Time Wailing Souls - Back Out John Holt - Love and Understanding Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 116 - Numbers Special
item.description: Welcome aboard for another 3,600 seconds of fine Jamaican music, where today we’re going numerical and mathematical in the House of Reggae’s Numbers Special… The Paragons – My Number One Dennis Brown – What About The Half Delroy Wilson – One Two Three Stranger & Ken – Uno Dos Tres Culture – Two Sevens Clash Sister Nancy – One Two Mad Lads – Ten To One Sound Dimension – Ten To Ten Ray Darwin – Nothing Can Touch My 45 Dadawah – 72 Nations Dillinger – CB 200 Dillinger – Ninja 600 Badoo – Rocking Of The 5,000 Prince Hammer – 10,000 Lions Inner Circle – 80,000 Careless Ethiopians Half Pint – One In A Million Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 114 - History Special
item.description: Welcome aboard the time travel machine for a 500 year hill and gully ride through the centuries, as it’s time for the House of Reggae’s History Special… Early B – History Of Jamaica Shenley Duffus – Christopher Columbus Black Skulls – Black Slavery Days Mighty Diamonds & Papa Tullo – Morgan The Pirate Johnny Stray & Navada Joe – Heroes Connection Peter Metro – Seven Heroes King Burnett – Paul Bogle Burning Spear – Old Marcus Garvey Perfect – Talk Black Marcus Derrick Morgan – Forward March Delroy Wilson – Better Must Come Junior Byles – When Will Better Come Lady Ann – One Out Of Many Connection Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 113
item.description: It’s that time to settle in again for another 60 minutes of fine music from the beautiful island in the sun, sweet Jamaica, so pick yourself a fresh mango to eat and chop open a coconut to drink and press that play button below… Original Survivors – Beautiful Land (JA) Kali Blaxx – Farmer Man Linton Kwesi Johnson – Five Nights Of Bleeding John Holt – Strange Things Big Youth – Miss Lou Ring A Ding Carl Moore – Our Forefathers Died In The Sand Errol Gentles – Tell Me Why Ronnie Davis – Good News The Aggrovators – Version Slim Smith – Keep That Light Johnny Osbourne & The Prophets – Keep That Light U Brown – Me Chat You Rock Richie Spice – Play On Time Unlimited – Going Home Winston Samuels – The Greatest Dandy – Rudy A Message To You Bonnie – Did You Get The Message Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian
item.dc:creator: House of Reggae
item.itunes:summary:
It’s that time to settle in again for another 60 minutes of fine music from the beautiful island in the sun, sweet Jamaica, so pick yourself a fresh mango to eat and chop open a coconut to drink and press that play button below…
Original Survivors – Beautiful Land (JA) Kali Blaxx – Farmer Man Linton Kwesi Johnson – Five Nights Of Bleeding John Holt – Strange Things Big Youth – Miss Lou Ring A Ding Carl Moore – Our Forefathers Died In The Sand Errol Gentles – Tell Me Why Ronnie Davis – Good News The Aggrovators – Version Slim Smith – Keep That Light Johnny Osbourne & The Prophets – Keep That Light U Brown – Me Chat You Rock Richie Spice – Play On Time Unlimited – Going Home Winston Samuels – The Greatest Dandy – Rudy A Message To You Bonnie – Did You Get The Message
Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 112 - 1950's Special
item.description: Today we’re taking a journey right back to the birth of recorded music in Jamaica, to give a few nods of appreciation in the direction of the groundbreaking artists, producers and sound system owners who built from scratch the foundations of which everything that followed has been based on, as it’s time for the House of Reggae’s 1950’s Special… Lord Fly – Medley Of Jamaican Mento Harold Richardson – Glamour Gal Lord Flea – Naughty Little Flea Hubert Porter – Ten Penny Nail Chin’s Calypso Sextet – Rough Rider Count Lasher – Dalvey Gal Parson Wynonie Harris – Bloodshot Eyes Tab Smith – My Mother’s Eyes Willis Jackson – Later For The Gator Theophilus Beckford – Easy Snapping Laurel Aitken – Boogie Rock Higgs & Wilson – Manny Oh Derrick Morgan – Lover Boy Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 111
item.description: It’s time to take another lucky dip into the bag of fine Jamaican music and see what prizes await us today in an hour long show of trivia and tunes… Hopeton Lewis – Let Me Come On Home The Itals – Time Will Tell Louie Culture – Judgement Fi Babylon Errol Dunkley & Ranking Dread – Rush Me No Badness The Yardbrooms – If You See Jane Chuck & Dobby – Cool School Clue J & The Blues Blasters – Silky Larry Marshall – Mean Girl Junior Byles – Heart & Soul The Mighty Diamonds – I Need A Roof Luciano – Sweep Over My Soul Sizzla – Babylon A Listen Ray Darwin – People’s Choice Jesse Royal – Singing The Blues Tilly & Larry – Jah Gave Us Everything Count Ossie & Leslie Butler – Soul Drums Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 110 - Village Special
item.description: I’m opening the doors today for the whole community to come in and enjoy 60 minutes of fine Jamaican music that will either tell a great story or feature a particular character or facet of life in the House of Reggae’s Village Special… The Tennors – Hopeful Village Sugar Minott – Lamb’s Bread (Let Go The Dread) Dillinger – Dread Called Fred Lt. Stitchie – Natty Dread Max Romeo – Norman The Gaylads – Peculiar Man Lord Fly – Manassa With The Tight Foot Pants Junior Reid – Higgler Move Perfect – Hand Cart Boy The Meditations – Woman Piabba Theo Beckford – Boller Man Horace Andy – A Quiet Place King Tubby – A Noisy Place Winston Hussey – Joe Grine Twinkle Brothers – Miss Labba Labba Sugar Minott – All Kinda People Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

Stitchie – Natty Dread Max Romeo – Norman The Gaylads – Peculiar Man Lord Fly – Manassa With The Tight Foot Pants Junior Reid – Higgler Move Perfect – Hand Cart Boy The Meditations – Woman Piabba Theo Beckford – Boller Man Horace Andy – A Quiet Place King Tubby – A Noisy Place Winston Hussey – Joe Grine Twinkle Brothers – Miss Labba Labba Sugar Minott – All Kinda People

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 109
item.description: It’s time for another 60 minute celebration of fine Jamaican music, which will include something old, something new, something borrowed and some rhythm n blues… The Silvertones – Rejoice Jah Jah Children Lee Perry & The Silvertones – Finger Mash Red Dragon – Duck Dance Little Twitch – Every DJ Have To Burst Vybz Kartel – Poor People Land Protoje – Take Control Bobby Day – Over & Over Cornel Campbell – Dance In Greenwich Farm Jackie Mittoo – Darker Shade Of Black Augustus Pablo – Harder Shade Of Black Dennis Brown – Yagga Yagga (You’ll Suffer) Frankie Paul – Pass The Tu-Shung-Peng Sylford Walker – Burn Babylon The Zodiacs – Walk On By Lady Saw – Matrimoney The Ray-O-Vacs – My Baby’s Gone Delroy Wilson – My Baby Is Gone Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 108 - Old Time Lyrics Special
item.description: It’s time for another trip down memory lane, as today I’m delving deep into the rich traditional lyrical songs of Jamaica that have been passed down through the decades and adapted and updated into ska, reggae and dancehall versions in the House of Reggae’s Old Time Lyrics Special… Ranking Joe – Oh What A Night Dillinger – Healing Stream Max Romeo – Chi Chi Bud Sugar Minott – Wheel And Turn Me The Sensations – Long Time Me No See You Girl The Gaylads – Emmanuel Road TOK – Galang Gal Sowell Radics – Wheel O Matilda Nitty Gritty – Hog In A Minty The Pioneers – Dip And Fall Back Shenley Duffus – Rukumbine Eric Monty Morris – Penny Reel I Roy – Fire Stick I Roy – Welding Barrington Levy – Shine Eye Gal Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 107
item.description: Step this way for another 60 minute stroll across the hills and valleys of fine Jamaican music… The Skatalites – Ska La Parisienne The Sharks – You Made Me Warm Risto Benji – Don’t Pirate It Queen Ifrica – Pot Still Haffi Bubble Max Romeo – Heads A Go Roll The Skatalites – Addis Ababa The Skatalites – Smiling Vin Gordon – Heavenless Triston Palmer – Entertainment Half Pint – Greetings Augustus Pablo – Missing Link Tarrus Riley – Rebel Captain Sinbad – Worldwide Rebellion Bobby Soul – God Is Love Bobby Soul – Message From The Congo Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 106 - Answer Special
item.description: Today we’re going to have double the fun or even double the trouble as each tune I’ll be playing will be followed up by a counteraction, a contradiction or a continuation in the House of Reggae’s Answer Special… The Uniques – Let Me Go Girl Dawn Penn – I’ll Let You Go Dennis Brown – Money In My Pocket Dhaima – Can’t Buy My Love Beres Hammond – What One Dance Can Do Audrey Hall – One Dance Won’t Do Tenor Saw – Ring The Alarm Nitty Gritty – False Alarm Super Cat – Boops Junie Ranks – Cry Fi Mi Boops Shaggy – Church Heathen Ninjaman – The Pastor Buju Banton – Driver A Elephant Man – Bring It Buju Banton – Love Mi Browning Buju Banton – Love Mi Black Woman Yellowman – I’m Getting Married Yellowman – I’m Getting Divorced Prince Buster – Blackhead Chinaman Derrick Morgan – Blazing Fire Prince Buster – Watch It Blackhead Derrick Morgan – No Raise No Praise Bounty Killer – Spy Fi Die Beenie Man – Wicked Man Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 105
item.description: Roll up roll up for another 60 minutes of fine Jamaican music, that has been hand picked and lovingly packaged for you here today on the premises… The Skatalites – Freedom Sounds Priest Herman – We Are Praying Louie Culture – Revolution Song Junior Byles – The Long Way Lee Perry – Longer Dub The Pioneers – Easy Come Easy Go The Pioneers – Easy Come Easy Go Phil Pratt & Ken Boothe – Sweet Song For My Baby Al Campbell – Every Man Say Jo Jo Bennett & The Fugitives – The Lecture Ed Nangle – Good Girl Jim Brown – Seen Him Early B – Sunday Dish Buju Banton – Jungle To Back A Wall Tony Rebel – Jah Never Let Us Down Mr Vegas – Black & Proud McWoner – Nuh Fire It Lopez Walker – Jah Jah New Garden Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 104 - Drum Special
item.description: Today we’re going deep into the roots to hear the African inspired nyahbinghi sound, the pulsating and hypnotic bedrock of so many great Jamaican records, in the House of Reggae’s Drum Special… Karl Bryan & Count Ossie – Black Up Winston & Roy – Babylon Gone Folkes Brothers – Oh Carolina Bunny & Skitter – Lumumba Soul Vendors – Drum Song U Roy & Peter Tosh – Rightful Ruler Bongo Herman & Bingy Bunny – Know Far I Bongo Herman, Bongo Les & Bingy Bunny – Salaam Mystic Revelation Of Rastafari – Way Back Home Ras Michael & The Sons Of Negus – Run Aggressors Run Cocoa Tea & Shabba Ranks – Flag Flown High Sizzla – Make It Secure Fanton Mojah – Hail The King Gyptian – Serious Times Tarrus Riley – Shaka Zulu Pickney Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 103
item.description: It’s time to take another dive into the deep end of fine Jamaican music while occasionally coming up for air to comment on what’s being played, so grab your snorkel and flippers and press that play button below… Knowledge – Centry YT & Mr Williamz – Smiley Culture Sugar Minott – Herbman Hustling Burru Banton – MC Peggy Junior Byles – What Kind Of World The Tonettes – Love That Is Real Merlene Webber – Hard Life The Heptones – Get In The Groove Sugar Minott – Hang On Natty John Holt – Up Park Camp Junior Delgado & I Roy – Camp Road Skanking Gregory Isaacs – Slave Master Barrington Levy – Shine Eye Gal Garnett Silk – Retreat Wicked Man Jesse Jender – Oppressors The Progressions – Fair Deal Lukie D & Busy Signal – Man A Yardie Richie Stephens – No Sah Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian LATEST: As mentioned in this show, the interview with me and Claus is now available to download at his website http://www.yardie-reggae.com/

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 102 - Life Special
item.description: As a counteraction to the Death Special a few weeks ago, today I’ll be digging out an hour’s worth of tunes that celebrate the joys of being alive, while recognising the struggles it can take to survive, and like a good self help book, giving out some pertinent advice on how to live your life to the fullest in the House of Reggae’s Life Special… Bob Andy – Life Phyllis Dillon – One Life To Live Delano Stewart – That’s Life Big Youth – Facts Of Life Wayne Wade – Man Of The Living Jah Stitch – No Dread Can’t Dead Dr Alimantado – Born For A Purpose Dennis Brown – Things In Life Alton Ellis – Live & Learn Ken Boothe – Live Good Sugar Minott – Live Loving Etana – People Talk Luciano – Never Give Up My Pride Prince Buster – Enjoy Yourself Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

Bob Andy – Life Phyllis Dillon – One Life To Live Delano Stewart – That’s Life Big Youth – Facts Of Life Wayne Wade – Man Of The Living Jah Stitch – No Dread Can’t Dead Dr Alimantado – Born For A Purpose Dennis Brown – Things In Life Alton Ellis – Live & Learn Ken Boothe – Live Good Sugar Minott – Live Loving Etana – People Talk Luciano – Never Give Up My Pride Prince Buster – Enjoy Yourself
Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 101
item.description: In another show crammed full of old time classics, fresh new music and miscellany background details, I'll also be revealing which show has been the most popular House of Reggae podcast so far... Jah Woosh – Jah Is The Ruler Tarrus Riley – Shaka Zulu PIckney Alpheus – Far Away Jah Woosh – Chalice Blaze Lady Saw – Sycamore Tree Tanya Stephens – Yuh Nuh Ready Fi Dis Yet Jackie Opel – You Send Me Lester Sterling – African Beat Welton Irie – Soma A Holla Some A Bawl Barrington Levy – Under Mi Sensi Johnny Osbourne – Bring The Sensi Come Capleton – Caan Tan Yah Courtney John – Never Keep You Waiting Earl Cunningham – Hungry Days The Palmer Brothers – Step It Out Of Babylon Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian

item.title: House of Reggae Pt. 100 - Death Special
item.description: Welcome in for another dig through the archives of fine Jamaican music, and this week we’re going deep, deep ,deep, in fact we’re going six feet under, in the House of Reggae’s Death Special… Lloyd Robinson – Death A Come Prince Buster – Hard Man Fe Dead Winston Samuels – Be Prepared Bushman – Call The Hearse The Wailers – Funeral Prince Alla – Funeral Derrick Morgan – Father Killam The Wailers – Mr Brown Pad Anthony – Death To A Sound Cocoa Tea – We Do The Killing Clint Eastwood & General Saint – Tribute To General Echo Johnny Osbourne – Dub Organiser Sugar Minott & Joseph Cotton – Tribute To Sir Coxsone Log on to www.reggaeworldmusic.com every Friday between 8 - 10pm UK time to hear the House of Reggae live. Thanks, Ian
